function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Measuring the between-ness centrality of road networks surrounding railway stations may ignore other factors influencing disease spread.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of disease propagation risk and ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Incorporate additional factors such as population density, sanitation infrastructure, and human mobility patterns into disease risk assessment around railway stations.","Technologies":"GIS mapping tools, machine learning algorithms for pattern recognition, and epidemiological modeling software.","People":"Residents living near railway stations, commuters using public transport, and city residents in general.","Owner":"Public health authorities, city planners, and transportation agencies."},{"Description":"Travel time by public transport to activity centers may impact the spread of epidemics within cities.","Impact":"Increased risk of epidemic spread if travel time by public transport facilitates the movement of infected individuals to activity centers.","Mitigation":"Implement targeted public health measures at activity centers, improve public transport sanitation and ventilation, and regulate capacity to reduce crowding.","Technologies":"Public transport scheduling and tracking systems, health surveillance systems, and crowd management technology.","People":"Residents living near activity centers, commuters using public transport, and visitors to activity centers.","Owner":"Public health authorities, public transportation agencies, and city government."}]}
